text: - My name is Aarthi Raju.

I am a senior manager for
solutions architecture
here at AWS.

And my team focuses on
helping customers and partners

migrate their enterprise
workloads into the cloud.

The partner solutions
architecture role is a key role,

it's a builder role at AWS
where we work with partners

who are innovating on
behalf of our customers.

Solutions architects sit
with partners as they design
and build architectures on,
"Hey, how do I migrate to the cloud?
Help me understand how to do it."
So our SAs sit with the partners

to help them understand
therefore they can now work

with customers in order
to innovate on behalf
of the customers.
(upbeat music)
I've been with AWS for nine years now.

I started here as a new
grad back in the days.
I started as a cloud support engineer

and then moved in as
a solutions architect.

And then, now manage a team
of solutions architects here.
If I had a friend who called me and asked,

"Hey, Aarthi, should I
take up this role at AWS?"
I would ask them a couple of questions.
My first question is,
"Are you willing to continuously learn?"
Technology is changing so much

and AWS, as a company,
it's always day one here.

We learn continuously,
no matter what role.
Technical roles, non-technical roles.

And then the second is
that builder's mentality.

I think the builder's mentality
is somebody who's looking

to innovate, somebody who's
looking to build a solution
for our customers

or building innovative solutions
on behalf of our customers.

So as long as they're up for
this challenge, come join AWS.
